meta.title: THE HAMIEVERSE CODEX: Songs the City Forgot
meta.intended_use: Claude Code agent memory + consistency anchor
warnings: This JSON is a lore bible/continuity file, not a scene-by-scene reproduction.
All details are derived from the provided PDF; if you add later books/chapters, extend this file rather than overwrite.

logline: A numbered factory worker in a motion-mandated surveillance city discovers a cracked pendant concealing a bridge chip and a USB that unlock the Undercode—an attention-driven shadow economy able to destabilize Aetherion—forcing him to choose between compliance, love, and a dangerous new identity: Simba.

tone_and_style.narration: sensory, lyrical, tense; warmth of memory cutting through sterile systems

dialogue_rules.city_workers: short, careful, emotionally guarded; jokes are clipped and coded
dialogue_rules.ironpaws: flat procedural phrasing; regulation codes; minimal empathy
dialogue_rules.undercode_elites: charismatic, ironic, performative; power-talk framed as narrative steering

identity_policy.rule: In the City, personal identity is suppressed; citizens are known by numeric IDs.
identity_policy.narrative_effect: Names feel like contraband; using one can signal trust or danger.

motion_policy.rule: Movement is mandatory; infrastructure enforces motion via belts, treadmills, and flow systems.
motion_policy.consequence: Stillness reads as a fault in the machine—psychologically and politically.

surveillance.rule: Observation is constant via Red Eye cameras, terminals, and IronPaw patrols.
surveillance.exception: Surveillance can be disrupted temporarily through Undercode countermeasures (e.g., Doppel Protocol).

contraband.rule: Unregistered devices (chips, USBs, hidden storage) are forbidden; punishment escalates to disappearance.
contraband.stakes: Possession turns an object into a bomb (socially and physically).

beyond_doctrine.rule: The City claims its sacrifice preserves the Beyond’s purity.
beyond_doctrine.function: Moral alibi for exploitation; seeds resentment in those who remember the Beyond.

attention_economy.rule: In the Undercode, attention/virality functions as currency and as leverage over markets and security systems.

memory_persistence.rule: Songs, hums, chants, and oral memory can survive suppression and reactivate identity.
memory_persistence.function: Music acts like encryption—portable, human, hard to police.

the_city.mantra_at_sunrise: Work is purpose. Order is freedom. Obedience is peace.

the_wheel.description: A spiraling rail-and-gear structure powered by Hamster Orbs: each orb contains a living runner acting as a battery.

tower_c_12.description: Hamie’s shoebox flat of steel and observation with a ceiling Red Eye camera.

central_factory_gates.description: Cold metal teeth opening daily to receive workers into repetition.

the_overpass_ruins.description: A crumbling underpass beneath the City where the homeless man and dog lived; later becomes an IronPaw hunting ground.

daily_life.uniform: Sand-grey regulation-compliant utility rags, unchanged for years.
daily_life.food: Cube-shaped protein blocks; cafeteria rituals under watch.
daily_life.work: Energy Relay Maintenance (ERM): conduits, blinking panels, heat, oil; strict procedures around repairs.

surveillance_stack.red_eyes: Ceiling/wall cameras that blink and log behavior.
surveillance_stack.ironpaws: Enforcers with red visors and protocol language.
surveillance_stack.investigations: Outside teams called in when a rule is broken; interrogations and disappearances spike.

virella.description: Hamie’s remembered home: grass under bare paws, woodsmoke, elders’ faces in firelight, roasted crickets; later referenced as location of a care facility.

virella_care_facility.description: Grandma’s room; distant but emotionally central via calls.

presentation: ghostlike logos appearing in interface corners
countdowns that pulse before viral attacks

respeculators_penthouse.description: Neon-lit city views; strategic discussions; pills; late-night charisma; the rebellion-as-mask headquarters.

neon_spire.description: Coded invitation location: Neon Spire, midnight sharp; associated with an ancient/alien emblem.

aetherion.notes: Aetherion functions like a state-corporation with ideological programming; portrayed as oppressive and efficiency-obsessed.

section_9.function: Erases people and traces; appears as a named cleanup action around the overpass event.

undercode.core_concept: Influence is currency; culture is an attack vector.
capabilities: echoloops (tank stocks via waves of attention)

AC.name: AC
AC.function: Denominates wealth and influence in the Undercode.

creator_elite.function: Forged badge overlay granting prestige/permissions inside the network.

doppel_protocol.function: Can dissolve surveillance at a local node (e.g., disabling the ceiling Red Eye).

respeculators.true_mode: Narrative/market steering in the grey zone; rebellion as mask until a certain point.
doctrine: Burn enough to light the path, not enough to destroy the fuel.
Change without wealth/power ends under the Wheel.
respeculators.relationship_to_simba: Sees Simba as a dangerous new asset and potential answer to long-held questions.

hamster_orbs.definition: Energy nodes containing a living runner powering circuits through motion.
hamster_orbs.symbolic_role: Citizens mirror the orbs—running to uphold an impossible system.

workplace_mechanics.erm: Energy Relay Maintenance; conduits, terminals, and strict compliance around repairs.
workplace_mechanics.burnout: Common pretext used to miss work without scrutiny; institutionalized exhaustion.

self_dismissal_procedure.definition: Worker request for immediate termination of employment rights.
self_dismissal_procedure.stakes: Not framed as freedom; risk of being ground under the Wheel if you fall out of the system.

protocol_four_seven_grey.definition: Burnout delay protocol invoked to postpone a self-dismissal request pending evaluation.
protocol_four_seven_grey.effect: Creates a small pocket of choice/time under surveillance.

undercode_ops.echo_raid: Coordinated action to disrupt liquidity/shadow banking flows.
undercode_ops.echoloop: Short explosive post designed to tank stocks through cultural attention waves.
undercode_ops.viral_loop: Media payload engineered to overwhelm/fry security AIs.
undercode_ops.aethercreed_operation: Example viral op: 'Operation: Fuck the System' with countdown and mocking hamster media.

butterfly.meaning: Fleeting freedom, caged power, the ache of choice denied.

music_progression.meaning: Memory and resistance scaling from private signal to collective force.

the_red_eye.meaning: Obedience made architectural; surveillance as domestic presence.

the_pendant.meaning: Memory artifact and key; cracked but alive; contains hidden bridge tech.

the_dog.meaning: Survival, loyalty, living archive; carries hidden storage.

glossary.IronPaws: Black-armored enforcers; speak in protocols; conduct patrols, interrogations, cleanups.
glossary.Red Eye: Ceiling/wall surveillance camera that blinks and logs.
glossary.The Wheel: Colossal spiraling construct; City’s power symbol; driven by living runners in Hamster Orbs.
glossary.Hamster Orbs: Energy orbs containing a living runner acting as a battery.
glossary.ERM: Energy Relay Maintenance work unit; conduit/terminal maintenance under strict rules.
glossary.Section 9: Cleanup operation; escalated enforcement that erases people/traces.
glossary.Subject #101B: A subject referenced during investigations; tied to the missing USB inquiry.
glossary.Self-dismissal procedure: Request to terminate employment rights; framed as dangerous rather than freeing.
glossary.Protocol Four-Seven-Grey: Burnout delay protocol invoked by #257A to pause Hamie’s self-dismissal request.
glossary.Undercode: Shadow digital ecosystem where attention/virality drives currency and power.
glossary.AC: Echo currency used in the Undercode.
glossary.Echo raid: Undercode operation to disrupt liquidity/shadow banks.
glossary.Echoloop: Short viral post designed to tank markets via attention waves.
glossary.Doppel Protocol: Forbidden mimic-script that can dissolve surveillance (e.g., disable the Red Eye).
glossary.Creator elite: Status marker in the Undercode; can be forged/overlaid.
glossary.Neonburn: Alcohol referenced as sour on breath; used to numb or signal elite excess.
glossary.Neon Spire: Rendezvous location named in a coded invitation; associated with an ancient emblem.

hamie.arc: A compliant runner becomes Simba in the Undercode after unlocking contraband tech and gaining sudden influence.

simba_digital_identity.meaning: Hamie’s Undercode persona; marks his shift from faceless worker to player in a larger game.
known_events: Creator elite marker is overlaid/forged on his digital badge

grandma.function: Emotional anchor; calls reveal Hamie’s fatigue and the persistence of love across distance.

notable_actions: Invokes Protocol Four-Seven-Grey to delay Hamie’s self-dismissal request
Warns that falling out of the Wheel means being ground under it
257A.symbolic_role: Embodies survived resistance—small cracks of choice inside the machine.

479C.notes: Associated with subtle identity rebellion (e.g., pink markers/studs).

mitch.notable_info: Explains the bridge chip concept/function; unusually uses a real name in a world of numbers.

doctrine: Influence is the point, not trust.
Use rebellion as mask to evade scrutiny while amassing power.
sam.interest_in_simba: Views Simba as dangerous and unpredictable, and as a potential answer to questions he has long wanted solved.
sam.private_context: Shown in vulnerable drugged/pill-fueled late-night moments, but remains strategic.

lira.dynamics: Rolls eyes at Sam’s nicknames; participates in recruitment strategy; wary of Simba.

luna.species_note: Described as a lithe ferret with eyes like spun glass.
luna.notable_line_summary: Warns Simba he is 'running on empty' during Undercode-fueled nights.

homeless_man_under_overpass.notes: Linked to the pendant and the melody motif; disappears during cleanup/investigation escalation.

dog_simba.notes: Connected to the overpass; carries hidden storage in collar; returns after the man disappears.

alistair_veynar.notes: Represents inherited malevolent power framed as a curse.

silas.notes: Observes abuse from behind a doorframe; a seed of future divergence.

veynar_mother.notes: Reinforces the ideology that kindness is weakness; expects emotional suppression.

prologue.title: PROLOGUE
beats: Elite household: Alistair Veynar punishes a boy for showing emotion and 'weakness'.
Family power is described as malevolent and inherited like a curse.
A butterfly outside a window symbolizes fleeting freedom.
Silas watches silently from behind a doorframe, tense and unable to intervene.

chapters.title: A HUM
beats: The City is introduced as an industrial titan powered by the Wheel and Hamster Orbs.
Sunrise mantra broadcasts obedience into citizens’ bodies.
Hamie wakes in Tower C-12 under a Red Eye camera, exhausted from years without true rest.
Hamie remembers the Beyond in fragments—grass, woodsmoke, roasted crickets, elders in firelight—especially Virella.
Daily routine: regulation uniform, moving infrastructure, work funneling life into the factory system.

chapters.title: A CHANT
beats: Hamie’s world tightens; the overpass seam becomes a locus of danger and curiosity.
Section 9 is referenced as escalation; enforcement presence grows harsher.
The dog (Simba) and the overpass connection sharpen Hamie’s sense that the City’s narrative is a lie.
Contraband stakes begin to crystallize as hidden objects become potential death sentences.

chapters.title: A MELODY
beats: A USB becomes central: it is treated as a 'live grenade' with secrets that could shatter control.
Grandma checks in from Virella care facility; Hamie lies about being fine.
Factory headquarters shifts: investigation teams arrive; interrogations begin.
Workers disappear; whispers ask about Subject #101B and the USB.
Hamie returns toward the overpass ruins despite danger; IronPaws search blankets and crevices.

chapters.title: A HYMN
beats: Hamie attempts self-dismissal (termination of employment rights) at the central terminal.
An IronPaw logs the request and demands confirmation.
#257A intervenes, invoking Protocol Four-Seven-Grey to delay self-dismissal due to burnout.
#257A warns: leaving the Wheel doesn’t mean freedom; it can mean being ground under it.
Cut to Respeculators: Sam outlines recruitment strategy—offer protection/resources to steer the narrative.
Respeculators are described as thriving in grey zones: rebellion as mask, power accumulation as true aim.
Sam becomes fixated on Simba as a new, unpredictable piece on the board.

chapters.title: A SONG
beats: Hamie scrolls Undercode ops: echo raids, viral loops, echoloops tanking stocks via attention waves.
Aethercreed operation launches with countdown and a mocking hamster; markets convulse under synchronized chaos.
Hamie clicks buy—confirmation hits: +13,000,000 AC.
Undercode consumes Hamie’s time; he learns legacy codes, hidden plugins, and deploys the Doppel Protocol.
The Red Eye in Hamie’s ceiling flickers and goes dark.
Hamie’s badge gains a forged creator elite marker; he misses work under burnout pretext.
Luna warns Simba he is running on empty; nightlife and influence spiral together.
A coded invitation arrives with an ancient emblem: rendezvous at the Neon Spire, midnight sharp.
Hamie ends in doubt: can he survive the game he has entered?

continuity_constraints: City residents default to numeric IDs; names are rare and meaningful.
The City’s infrastructure enforces motion; characters feel pulled/dragged by it.
Surveillance is constant unless explicitly disabled by Undercode countermeasures.
IronPaws speak procedurally and escalate based on protocol logic, not emotion.
Undercode actions translate into real-world consequences (market shocks, security failures, scrutiny).
Respeculators present as rebels publicly but operate as power brokers privately.
do_not_invent: Do not invent additional chapters beyond 1–5 for this book without new source material.
Do not change the sunrise mantra wording.
Do not portray Aetherion as benevolent or accidental.
